page.title: 02THE BULLS HEAD
page.content: The{Bulls Head}in Market Street is said to be the oldest building in Ashby. It dates from 1350-1390.It used to be a tailors shop but is now a Public House and a Coffee Shop.The only famous person who has stayed was Col.Bembridge when the Parliamentarians beseiged Ashby Castle,during the Civil War.There is believed to be a bullet-hole in the dining-room dating from this time. On the inside walls hang pictures of Old Ashby and horses tack.On the outside there is a 14th. century Inn sign. The only original part of the building is the front,and the small bar.The oak beams were initially from an old ships hull.There are 13 rooms. The most popular drink is "Burton Bitter".
